æ•™å¤§åŒå­¸ä»”
ä¾å®¶å‰¯æ ¡è©±è½æ—¥è¦ç•ªå­¸å•Š
ä»²ç•ªå­¸å•Šï¼Ÿç½·èª²æˆ–è€…é€¼åˆ°ä½¢ç¹¼çºŒåœèª²å•¦ï¼

æœ‰é‘‘æ–¼æ ¡æ–¹ä¸ç†å­¸ç”Ÿå®‰å±ï¼Œæ˜å¤©å¦‚å¸¸ä¸Šèª²ï¼Œä»¥ä¸‹æ˜¯è¦æ±‚æ ¡æ–¹å–æ¶ˆèª²å ‚çš„é›»éƒµï¼Œå¹«æ‰‹send è¿”ä½¢æ¯”VPğŸ™ğŸ» è‡ªå·±åŒå­¸è‡ªå·±æ•‘
vpac-pr@eduhk.hk

Dear Professor Lee,

Referring to the arrangement of tomorrow (13/11) by the school, all classes and examinations are as scheduled. However, the situation in Hong Kong is getting more serious day by day, and even now, some areas nearby, such as Tai Wo Road and CUHK are full of tear gas. This morning, many students were caught by the police without any reason, some were just wearing school uniforms, walking their way to school only. It proved that it is not a safe environment for our schoolmates to attend the class, and the incident in CUHK proved that the school has no enough power and force to protect the campus. Please consider the current serious situation in Hong Kong and the safety issue of students. It is because nothing is more important than the students' safety. Please cancel all the classes and examinations of EdUHK tomorrow.

Best regards,

vpac-pr@eduhk.hk

Dear Professor Lee,

Referring to the arrangement of tomorrow (13/11) by the school, all classes and examinations are as scheduled. However, the situation in Hong Kong is getting more serious day by day, and even now, some areas nearby, such as Tai Wo Road and CUHK are full of tear gas. This morning, many students were caught by the police without any reason, some were just wearing school uniforms, walking their way to school only. It proved that it is not a safe environment for our schoolmates to attend the class, and the incident in CUHK proved that the school has no enough power and force to protect the campus. Please consider the current serious situation in Hong Kong and the safety issue of students. It is because nothing is more important than the students' safety. Please cancel all the classes and examinations of EdUHK tomorrow.

Best regards,

replies.msg:
å«ä½¢send å»registry


Dear Registry,

I am writing to express my utmost concern of high probability of traffic congestion tomorrow. As some of the universities have been announced that their class would be suspended tomorrow. Student strike and protests would be continuously affect our city.

At this morning, The security booth near SH Ho building arrested four students, our students were treated as ‘suspect’, which was unjustifiable and excessive. In addition, Hong Kong Police force sent staff unreasonably search our residential college, which brought tremendous inconvenience to our students.

It would be grateful if registry determine to suspend the class up to the social stability resume, in order to ensure students’ safety.

Regards
Your name
